## R Markdown


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(ggplot2)
library(markdown)
library(rmarkdown)
library(tidyr)
library(tidyselect)
library(tidyverse)
```

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(readxl)
LungCapData <- read_excel("_data/LungCapData.xls")
View(LungCapData)                                                              
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
m_lung<-mean(LungCapData$LungCap)
sd_lung<-sd(LungCapData$LungCap)

hist(LungCapData$LungCap, prob= TRUE, xlim = c(0, 20))
curve(dnorm(x, m_lung, sd_lung), add= TRUE,lwd= 2,col= "blue")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Untitled_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

# Section 1 Question 1
Looks like a normal distribution


### Question 2


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
grouped_gender<- LungCapData %>% group_by(Gender)
summarize(grouped_gender)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 2 × 1
  Gender
  <chr> 
1 female
2 male  
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
qplot(data = grouped_gender, x = Gender, y = LungCap, geom = "boxplot")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Untitled_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-8-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

Males have a higher mean than females. 

### Question 3
Smokers have a higher mean

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
grouped_smokers<- LungCapData %>% group_by(Smoke)
summarize(grouped_smokers)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 2 × 1
  Smoke
  <chr>
1 no   
2 yes  
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
qplot(data = grouped_smokers, x = Smoke, y = LungCap, geom = "boxplot")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Untitled_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-10-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



### Question 4
Looks like the lung capacity is highest for children ages 0-13, specifically for males. 

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
LungCapData$Agegroups<-cut(LungCapData$Age,breaks=c(-Inf, 13, 15, 17, 20), labels=c("0-13 years", "14-15 years", "16-17 years", "18+ years"))

ggplot(LungCapData, aes(x = LungCap, y = Agegroups, fill = Gender)) +
          geom_bar(stat = "identity") +
          coord_flip() +
          theme_classic()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Untitled_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-12-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## Question 5
Doesnt look like its good being a smoker under the age of 18, or any age. Lung capacity is smaller for these groups

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(LungCapData, aes(x = LungCap, y = Agegroups, fill = Smoke)) +
    geom_bar(stat = "identity") +
    coord_flip() +
    theme_classic()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Untitled_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-14-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



## Question 6


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
covar<-cov(LungCapData$LungCap, LungCapData$Age)
print(covar)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 8.738289
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
corre<-cor(LungCapData$LungCap, LungCapData$Age, method = "pearson")
print(corre)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 0.8196749
```
:::
:::



# Section 2 Question 2
 

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
a<-128/810
a
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 0.1580247
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
b<-434/810
b
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 0.5358025
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
c<-160/810
c
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 0.1975309
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
d<-64/810
d
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 0.07901235
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
e<-24/810
e
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 0.02962963
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
ei<-((a*0)+(b*1)+(c*2)+(d*3)+(e*4))
ei
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 1.28642
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
varei<-((0-ei)^2+(1-ei)^2+(2-ei)^2+(3-ei)^2+(4-ei)^2)/5
varei
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 2.509197
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
sdei<-sqrt(varei)
sdei
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 1.584044
```
:::
:::
